title: Display specific applicant visa approval details for reference lookup

requirements.summary: Display applicant name, visa type, status, and approval date in clear, readable format matching Australian Government website style
acceptanceCriteria: Applicant name is displayed prominently when results are shown
Visa type 'Work Visa' is clearly labeled and visible
Approval status is displayed with appropriate styling
Approval date is formatted according to Australian locale standards (DD/MM/YYYY)

file_operations.description: Update the results display section to prominently show applicant name, visa type, approval status, and formatted approval date. Ensure the applicant name appears at the top of the results card in a larger font. Display visa type with clear labeling (e.g., 'Visa Type: Work Visa'). Style the approval status with appropriate visual treatment (e.g., green badge for 'Approved'). Format the approval date (lastUpdated field) using Australian locale standards (DD/MM/YYYY) with the toLocaleDateString method using 'en-AU' locale. Maintain the existing Australian Government Department of Home Affairs styling with dark navy header and coat of arms logo.
